title: Stomach Pain After Leftover Rice
description: The patient complains of stomach issues after eating old rice.

script.text: Hi doctor... I think something's wrong with my stomach.
I had some rice that was left over from last week... it didn’t smell bad though.
I’ve been to the bathroom three times already today.
I don’t feel like eating anything, and I’ve just been lying in bed.

title: Stomach Pain and Missed Period
description: The patient has early signs of pregnancy but isn’t yet aware of it.

script.text: I’ve had this dull cramping in my lower stomach for a few days now...
At first I thought it was just PMS or something... but my period is late.
I’ve also been feeling really tired and kinda nauseous in the mornings.
It might be nothing... but it’s not normal for me to feel this off.

title: ENT Sinusitis Consultation Overview
description: The nurse explains a patient's sinusitis case to a student during morning rounds.

script.text: Okay, so this patient is here for persistent sinus problems — started about two weeks ago.
She’s experiencing postnasal drainage, facial pain, headaches, nasal congestion, and even some teeth pain.
The symptoms get worse in the mornings and evenings, which is common with sinus drainage pooling.
On exam, there's bilateral maxillary sinus tenderness, moderate nasal congestion, and purulent mucus. Water’s view X-ray confirmed mucosal thickening.
We're treating with Augmentin and MucoFen. Also advising smoking cessation, since she smokes a pack a day — which could be worsening inflammation.

title: Sinus Pain and Nasal Congestion
description: Salma reports worsening sinus symptoms over the past two weeks.

script.text: صباح الخير يا دكتور. أنا جيت علشان عندي مشكلة مستمرة في الجيوب الأنفية.
بقالها تقريبًا أسبوعين، وأنا حاسة بإفرازات خلف الأنف، والتهاب في الحلق، وألم في الوجه.
كمان عندي صداع مستمر واحتقان في الأنف... والأسوأ إنه بيزيد الصبح وبالليل.
أنا لاحظت كمان صوتي بقى مبحوح شوية، ونفسي مش مرتاح قوي وأنا نايمة بسبب الشخير.
باخد كلاريتين حاليًا، وكنت استعملت بخاخ رينوكورت قبل كده.
بس الصراحة التدخين يمكن مأثر عليّ... أنا بدخن تقريبًا علبة في اليوم بقاله ١٥ سنة.

title: Paranoid Schizophrenia – Medication Noncompliance
description: The attending explains a psychiatric case to a student intern during an inpatient consult.

script.text: This is a 30-year-old male with chronic paranoid schizophrenia, admitted for worsening paranoia and agitation.
He flew from Houston to Seattle and was deplaned after accusing flight staff of plotting against him.
He broke a window at a shelter and ended up in jail briefly. He’s now on an involuntary hold but calm today.
No substance abuse history. He’s been noncompliant with meds for two weeks — he was on Invega and Abilify.
He appears disorganized but oriented. Delusions are still present. We’re restarting his previous regimen and adding Cogentin to manage EPS if needed.

title: Normal Physical Exam - Nurse POV
description: Nurse relays findings of a routine physical exam to student nurse.

script.text: Alright, let's begin with the **eyes**. The conjunctivae are clear, and the pupils are round and reactive. This is a good sign, indicating that the neurological response is normal.
Next, we’ll move to the **ears, nose, and mouth**. The ears are normal, with no drainage or erythema. The **oral mucosa** is moist and pink. The **tonsils** look normal with no exudate.
For the **cardiovascular exam**, the **heart sounds** are normal with no murmurs or gallops. The carotid arteries are clear, and the peripheral pulses are strong.
Finally, we checked the **musculoskeletal system**. The patient has a normal gait and no signs of joint instability. All joints move without any discomfort, which is a good sign.

title: Normal Physical Exam - Doctor POV
description: Doctor relays findings of a routine physical exam to student nurse.

script.text: Let's start with the **eyes**. The conjunctivae are clear, and there is no sign of any lesions. The **pupils** are reactive, and the **funduscopic exam** shows sharp disk margins, indicating good vascular health.
Moving on to the **respiratory system**, the patient has clear lungs with no wheezes or crackles. The chest expansion is normal, and percussion is unremarkable.
For the **cardiovascular exam**, the **PMI** is normal, and we did not hear any murmurs or rubs. The peripheral pulses are palpable and strong, and there is no sign of edema.
Finally, I checked the **neurological status**. The **cranial nerves** are intact, and the patient’s **reflexes** are symmetrical. There’s no ataxia, which suggests normal cerebellar function.
